zone.line: and my sunken cheek, before pale,
burned with a hectic fever. One by
one these symptoms struck me; &
I became convinced that the moment
I had so much desired was about to
arrive and that I was dying. I
was sitting by my fire, the physician
who had attended me ever since
my fever had just left me, and I
looked over his prescription in
which digitalis was the prominent
medecine. "Yes," I said, "I see how
this is, and it is strange that I
should have deceived myself so long;
I am about to die an innocent
death, and it will be sweeter even
than that which the opium pro-
mised."
I rose and walked slowly to the
window; the wind wide heath
a was covered by snow which spark
